text: This document specifies the requirements for the development of a “Smart House”, called DigitalHome (DH), by the DigitalHomeOwner Division of HomeOwner Inc.
example: These document were prepared by the DigitalHomeOwner Division, in consultation with the Marketing Division of HomeOwner Inc.
The Digital Home High Level Requirements Definition is intended as a prototype, which will allow business decisions to be made about future development of a commercial product.
The product is based on the Digital Home High Level Requirements Definition.
The development team will use the development process specified by the Digital HomeOwner Inc.

This initial version of DigitalHome will be a limited prototype version, which will be used by HomeOwner management to make business decisions about the future commercial development of DigitalHomeOwner products and services.
For a given month and year, in the past two years, DigitalHome shall be able to provide a report on the management and control of the home.
Where possible, the DigitalHome project will employ widely used, accepted, and available hardware and software technology and standards, both for product elements and for development tools.

Each DigitalHome shall contain a master control device (the DigitalHome Gateway Device) that connects to the home’s broadband Internet connection, and uses wireless communication to send and receive communication between the DigitalHome system and the home devices and systems.
HomeOwner has designated object-oriented development, using UML 2.0, as the preferred method for development of software for HomeOwner products.
The DigitalHome System shall allow a web-ready computer, cell phone or PDA to control a home's temperature, humidity, lights, security, and the state of small appliances.

text: The Digital Home system, for the purposes of this document, is a system that will allow a home user to manage devices that control the environment of a home.
example: The general user shall be able to use the DigitalHome system capabilities to monitor and control the environment in his/her home.
The DigitalHome System shall allow a web-ready computer, cell phone or PDA to control a home's temperature, humidity, lights, security, and the state of small appliances.
The communication center of the DigitalHome system shall be a DigitalHome home web server, through which a user shall be able to monitor and control home devices and systems.
The DigitalHome programmable humidistat shall allow a user to monitor and control a home’s humidity from any location, using a web ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.

DigitalHome Planner shall provide a user with the capability to direct the system to set various preset home parameters (temperature, humidity, security contacts, and on/off appliance/light status) for certain time periods.
The DigitalHome programmable thermostat shall allow a user to monitor and control a home’s temperature from any location, using a web ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.
A DigitalHome System shall have the capability to establish an individual home web server hosted on a home computer.
The DigitalHome programmable Appliance Manager shall provide for management of a home’s small appliances, including lighting units, by allowing a user to turn them on or off as desired.
The Digital Home System shall incorporate backup and recovery mechanisms.

The Smart House components consist of household devices (e.g., a heating and air conditioning unit, a security system, and small appliances and lighting units, etc.), sensors and controllers for the devices, communication links between the components, and a computer system, which will manage the components.

text: The development team will consist of five engineers.
example: The development team will use the development process specified by the Digital HomeOwner Inc.
These individuals are responsible for developing the software and will interact with the EVLA Correlator Monitor and Control System to ensure that it is functioning properly.
During startup, the Tactical Control System shall determine which of the 5 levels of interaction are achievable by the Tactical Control System configuration.
The SwRI software team shall provide system maintenance and software support.
As part of the final project report the development team will describe their efforts to minimize costs, including price comparisons between DigitalHome elements and comparable/competitive elements.
The Tactical Control System shall be capable of being interoperable with the installed payloads across the 5 levels of UAV interaction.
The Tactical Control System will have the capability to manage all operational C4I interfaces across all 5 levels of interaction.
Reliability will be ensured by extensive testing by the team members and mentors, if available.
The Tactical Control System shall be capable of being interoperable with Predator and Outrider UAVs across the 5 levels of UAV interaction.
This prioritization schema has been validated by a Joint Requirements Oversight Council (JROC) Memorandum.

text: The humidistat shall provide a “set point” humidity that is used to control humidifiers and dehumidifiers achieve the set point humidity.
example: The system shall include digital programmable humidistats, which shall be used to monitor and regulate the humidity of an enclosed space.
The humidistat shall provide a reading of the current humidity in the space where the humidistat is located.
A DigitalHome user shall be able to set the humidity level for a humidistat, from 30% to 60%, inclusive a 1% increments.

The controller part of thermostat shall provides a “set point” temperature that is used to control the flow of heat energy (by switching heating or cooling devices on or off as needed) to achieve the set point temperature.

The system shall include digital programmable thermostats, which shall be used to monitor and regulate the temperature of an enclosed space.
The sensor part of the thermostat has a sensitivity range between 14ºF and 104ºF (-10ºC and 40ºC).
The thermostats may be controlled individually or collectively, so that temperature can be controlled at different levels in different home spaces.
The thermostat shall provide a reading of the current temperature in the space where the thermostat is located.
A single humidistat shall be placed in an enclosed space (e.g., a room in the house) for which the humidity is to be controlled.

text: The ASPERA-3 instrument package will be flown on the Mars Express mission of the European Space Agency (ESA) and will be launched in June 2003 according to the current schedule.
example: The APAF ground data system is to provide data processing algorithms and support to IRF for the ASPERA-3 science team (including Co-I’s) in preparation for the Mission Operations and Data Analysis (MO&DA) phase of the Mars Express mission.
This Software Requirements Specification (SRS) identifies the requirements for the ASPERA-3 Processing and Archiving Facility (APAF) ground data system for the Mars Express mission.
ASPERA-3 data shall be calibrated and validated prior to depositing in the NASA PDS.
ASPERA-3 data shall be provided to NASA PDS in PDS-compliant form.
ASPERA-3 IDFS data and MEX OA IDFS data shall be provided to NASA PDS.

There are six components of the ASPERA-3 package, plus the orbit and attitude data from the spacecraft: Data Processing Unit(DPU), Electron Spectrometer(ELS), Ion Mass Analyzer(IMA), Neutral Particle Detector(NPD), Neutral Particle Imager(NPI), Scanning Unit(SU), Orbit/Attitude(OA).
ASPERA-3 data shall be provided to NASA PDS no later than 6 months after acquisition.

In addition, validation and archiving of all ASPERA-3 scientific data in the NASA Planetary Data System (PDS) within 6 months of receipt in a form useable by the general scientific community is to be provided by the APAF.

Web-based displays defined by ASPERA-3 team shall be provided where any available ASPERA-3 data (as opposed to just the most current) can be used for science analysis to support the ASPERA-3 team in meeting mission goals and objectives.
The APAF data system requirements for delivering the ASPERA-3 IDFS data, Mars Express Orbit/Attitude IDFS data, and software are described in the following table.

The Tactical Control System shall provide the necessary hardware and software functionality to allow the Tactical Control System to integrate with AFMSS.

example: Training software shall be alterable without affecting the configuration of the operational software.
